An agent encrypted the password with RSA, but accidentally leaked part of the private key. Can you recover the message from the ciphertext: 4161591438509987910748717794169519538408160167971501701194622208401430424755274222789877564136553619993495442323229409582816036375779796268871669344465403?

The flag format is flag{...}
n=6466276258258463575986360747240507675567207107225503671449573163736456226872276882049584489884690521743368297149476424304469764121284595507715695932908771, e=465947861240582879878004119747477959416503041679746513092940345723182488466509392431035275107385002215137309510808307297914992673397873771048469863474957, partial_p=10580341024521524757

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{8wjkfrqn}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4161591438509987910748717794169519538408160167971501701194622208401430424755274222789877564136553619993495442323229409582816036375779796268871669344465403
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=6466276258258463575986360747240507675567207107225503671449573163736456226872276882049584489884690521743368297149476424304469764121284595507715695932908771, e=465947861240582879878004119747477959416503041679746513092940345723182488466509392431035275107385002215137309510808307297914992673397873771048469863474957, partial_p=10580341024521524757
extra_info: p=66413877006006954950818010695259167749009599037579614894652604296121878227251, q=97363330523131580402576183967485510018671128946975429128861738838436064261521, Ï†(n)=6466276258258463575986360747240507675567207107225503671449573163736456226872113104842055351349337127548705552471708743576485209077261081164581137990420000
